main event: On December 5, 1957, in O'Fallon, Illinois, a civilian reported a sighting of an unidentified flying object (UFO) exhibiting sudden appearance, extreme brightness, and white burning parts breaking off before burning out within 2 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as being approximately four inches wide and ten feet long, with a solid bar of light and sparks emanating from it.
No photographs were included in the report, and there was insufficient information to determine the nature of the object, although it was suggested that it could possibly be a meteor.
The witnesses, including a housewife and an Air Policeman, were considered reliable by the reporting officer, Lt. Colonel Bernard F. Whitehouse.
The sighting took place at 0700Z, during the night, on State Route L3, approximately 2-3 miles north of Lebanon, Illinois.
Weather conditions at the time were described as clear, cold, and frosty, and there were contrails to the south, with no local aircraft flying at the time of the sighting.
witnesses: reliable witnesses, including a housewife and an Air Policeman
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
